Yam Soup

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the ultimate comfort food experience with this delightful Yam Soup recipe! Perfectly creamy and packed with flavor, this soup is not only delicious but also incredibly nutritious. Made with simple ingredients like yams, coconut milk, and fresh herbs, it’s a wonderful way to enjoy a hearty meal that warms you from the inside out. Whether you’re looking for an easy weeknight dinner or a comforting dish to impress your guests, this yam soup is sure to satisfy. With its velvety texture and rich taste, it’s a delightful combination of sweet and savory that everyone will love. Plus, this recipe is vegan-friendly, making it a great option for various dietary preferences. Let’s dive into the step-by-step process of creating this mouthwatering Yam Soup that’s perfect for any occasion!

Ingredients

yams

Choose firm, smooth-skinned yams without any blemishes. If yams are not available, sweet potatoes can be a great substitute, offering a similar texture and sweetness. When peeling, use a vegetable peeler for ease, and make sure to cut them into uniform pieces for even cooking.

onion

For a sweeter flavor, use yellow or sweet onions. If you're short on time, you can use shallots as a substitute. To enhance the flavor, consider caramelizing the onions before adding the garlic for a richer taste.

garlic

Fresh garlic is best for this recipe, but if you don't have any, garlic powder can be used as a substitute (1/8 teaspoon per clove). To enhance the garlic flavor, try roasting it before mincing. This gives it a milder, sweeter flavor.

vegetable broth

Opt for low-sodium vegetable broth to better control the saltiness of your dish. If you don’t have vegetable broth, chicken broth can be used, or you can make your own by simmering vegetables in water. For an umami boost, add a splash of soy sauce or tamari.

coconut milk

Full-fat coconut milk will provide a creamier texture, but low-fat versions can be used if you're looking to reduce calories. If you're allergic to coconut, try using cashew cream or almond milk, but adjust the seasoning as they will be less rich.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil is ideal for its flavor and health benefits. If you're looking for a different flavor, avocado oil or grapeseed oil can work well too. For added richness, you might consider adding a tablespoon of butter if dietary restrictions allow.

salt

Use kosher salt for better control over seasoning. Start with a small amount and adjust to taste as the soup simmers, especially since broth may already contain salt.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper will provide the best flavor. If you want a bit of spice, consider adding a pinch of cayenne pepper or using white pepper for a different flavor profile.

paprika

Smoked paprika adds a delightful depth and smokiness to the soup, while sweet paprika will enhance the color without the smokiness. If you don’t have paprika, a dash of cayenne or curry powder can add an interesting twist.

fresh parsley

Fresh parsley adds a bright, fresh flavor. If you don't have parsley, consider using cilantro or chives for a different flavor profile. Always add the herbs at the end to preserve their fresh taste.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Heat the Olive Oil

    In a large pot, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. This will create a flavorful base for your soup.

  • Step 2: Sauté Onions and Garlic

    Add 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves to the pot. Sauté for about 5 minutes, or until the onions become translucent. This step enhances the aroma and depth of flavor in your soup.

  • Step 3: Add Yams and Broth

    Stir in 2 cups of peeled and diced yams and 4 cups of vegetable broth. Increase the heat to bring the mixture to a boil.

  • Step 4: Simmer

    Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the yams are tender enough to be easily pierced with a fork. This allows the flavors to meld together.

  • Step 5: Blend the Soup

    Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. If you don't have one, carefully transfer the soup in batches to a blender. Always allow steam to escape when blending hot liquids to prevent splattering.

  • Step 6: Add Coconut Milk and Seasonings

    Stir in 1 cup of coconut milk for creaminess. Season with salt and black pepper to taste, and add 1 teaspoon of paprika for an extra kick.

  • Step 7: Serve and Garnish

    Ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with fresh parsley before serving hot. Enjoy your nutritious and delicious yam soup!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I peel and dice yams properly?

To peel yams, use a vegetable peeler or a knife to remove the skin. Make sure to cut off both ends first for stability. After peeling, cut the yam into even slices, then into strips, and finally into small cubes. This ensures they cook evenly.

What can I do if I don’t have an immersion blender?

If you don’t have an immersion blender, you can transfer the soup in batches to a regular blender. Just be careful not to fill the blender too full to avoid spills. Blend until smooth and then return it to the pot.

How do I know when yams are tender?

Yams are tender when you can easily pierce them with a fork or knife. This usually takes about 20 minutes of simmering, but you can check earlier if they are cut small.

What if I don’t have vegetable broth?

If you don’t have vegetable broth, you can substitute it with water, but consider adding extra seasonings like herbs or spices to enhance the flavor.

How can I safely cut onions without crying?

To minimize tears, chill the onion in the fridge for 30 minutes before cutting, use a sharp knife (which makes cleaner cuts), or cut the onion under running water. Wearing goggles can also help!

What is the best way to store leftover yam soup?

Let the soup cool completely, then transfer it to an airtight container. It can be refrigerated for up to 4 days or frozen for up to 3 months. Just make sure to leave some space at the top of the container if freezing, as liquids expand.

Can I add other vegetables to the yam soup?

Absolutely! Feel free to add vegetables like carrots, spinach, or bell peppers for added flavor and nutrition. Just ensure they are cut into similar-sized pieces for even cooking.

How do I adjust the seasoning if the soup is bland?

If your soup tastes bland, gradually add salt and pepper, tasting as you go. You can also add a splash of lemon juice or some hot sauce for extra flavor.

What is the purpose of the coconut milk?

Coconut milk adds creaminess and a subtle sweetness to the soup, balancing the earthy flavors of the yams. If you prefer a lighter soup, you can use less coconut milk or substitute it with another type of milk.

How can I make my soup thicker?

To thicken your soup, you can either blend a portion of it to create a creamier texture or add a little cornstarch mixed with water, stirring until it reaches your desired thickness.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This yam soup is naturally vegan and gluten-free, making it suitable for a wide range of dietary preferences. For a lower-fat option, you can substitute light coconut milk or use vegetable broth instead of using coconut milk altogether. Additionally, for those avoiding nightshades, consider omitting the paprika or substituting it with turmeric for a different flavor profile.

Pairings

For a delightful meal experience, pair the yam soup with crusty whole grain bread or a side of garlic toast. Grilled chicken or shrimp can also complement the dish if you're looking for added protein. As for beverages, consider serving with a crisp white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc, or a refreshing iced herbal tea to highlight the soup's sweetness and creaminess.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the yam soup in warm bowls to maintain its heat. A drizzle of coconut milk on top adds a beautiful visual element, and a sprinkle of freshly chopped parsley enhances flavor and freshness. For an elegant touch, consider serving with a side of roasted pumpkin seeds for added crunch and nutrition. This soup can also be served in shot glasses as an appetizer for a party or gathering, making it a fun and interactive starter.

Yam Soup

40 min
$10
250 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

VegetarianGluten-Free

Cuisine:

AmericanCaribbean

Course:

AppetizerMain Course

Tags:

easyhealthycomfort food

Occasions:

Weeknight DinnerFamily Gathering

Description

A creamy and comforting yam soup that is both hearty and easy to make, perfect for any day!

Ingredients

  • yams: 2 cups, peeled and diced
  • onion: 1, chopped
  • garlic: 2 cloves, minced
  • vegetable broth: 4 cups
  • coconut milk: 1 cup
  • olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
  • paprika: 1 teaspoon
  • fresh parsley: for garnish

Date Created:

11/23/2024
